description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/4645232842 at Thu Jul 13 06:59:37 UTC 2023

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

dataLinks.title: Gitaly Per-Node Service Aggregated SLIs Apdex SLO Analysis

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: Gitaly Per-Node Service Aggregated SLIs Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_node_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",monitor="global",type="gitaly"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_node_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",monitor="global",type="gitaly"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="gitaly"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_node_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",monitor="global",type="gitaly"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="gitaly"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_node_apdex:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",monitor="global",type="gitaly"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="gitaly"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_node_apdex:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",monitor="global",type="gitaly"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="gitaly"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)
targets.legendFormat: Gitaly Per-Node Service Aggregated SLIs | Latency/Apdex

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

panels.title: Gitaly Per-Node Service Aggregated SLIs Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_node_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",monitor="global",type="gitaly"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_node_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",monitor="global",type="gitaly"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="gitaly"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_node_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",monitor="global",type="gitaly"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="gitaly"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_node_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",monitor="global",type="gitaly"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="gitaly"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_node_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",monitor="global",type="gitaly"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="gitaly"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)
targets.legendFormat: Gitaly Per-Node Service Aggregated SLIs | Errors

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

panels.title: goserver SLI Apdex

  or

panels.title: goserver SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

This SLI monitors all Gitaly GRPC requests in aggregate, excluding the OperationService.
GRPC failures which are considered to be the "server's fault" are counted as errors.
The apdex score is based on a subset of GRPC methods which are expected to be fast.



### Observability Tools

* [Google Stackdriver Continuous Profiling](https://console.cloud.google.com/profiler;timespan=4h/gitaly;type=CPU/cpu?project=gitlab-production)
* [🐞 Sentry Releases: gitlab/gitaly-production](https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/gitaly-production/releases?environment=${environment})
* [🐞 Sentry issues](https://sentry.gitlab.net/gitlab/gitaly-production/issues?environment=${environment})
* [📖 Kibana: Gitaly logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.hostname,json.grpc.method,json.grpc.request.glProjectPath,json.grpc.code,json.grpc.time_ms),filters:!((meta:(key:json.fqdn,params:'$fqdn',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.fqdn:(query:'$fqdn',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:gitaly,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:gitaly,type:phrase))))),index:'AW5F1OHTiGcMMNRn84Di')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [📖 Kibana: Gitaly slow request logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.hostname,json.grpc.method,json.grpc.request.glProjectPath,json.grpc.code,json.grpc.time_ms),filters:!((meta:(key:json.fqdn,params:'$fqdn',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.fqdn:(query:'$fqdn',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:gitaly,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:gitaly,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.msg,params:unary,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.msg:(query:unary,type:phrase)))),(meta:(field:json.grpc.time_ms,index:'AW5F1OHTiGcMMNRn84Di',key:json.grpc.time_ms,params:(gte:1000,lte:!n),type:range),query:(range:(json.grpc.time_ms:(gte:1000,lte:!n))))),index:'AW5F1OHTiGcMMNRn84Di',sort:!(!(json.grpc.time_ms,desc)))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [📖 Kibana: Gitaly failed request logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.hostname,json.grpc.method,json.grpc.request.glProjectPath,json.grpc.code,json.grpc.time_ms),filters:!((meta:(key:json.fqdn,params:'$fqdn',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.fqdn:(query:'$fqdn',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:gitaly,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:gitaly,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.grpc.code,negate:!t,params:OK,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.grpc.code:(query:OK,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:exists,type:json.grpc.code,value:exists),query:(exists:(field:json.grpc.code)))),index:'AW5F1OHTiGcMMNRn84Di')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [📈 Kibana: Gitaly requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AW5F1OHTiGcMMNRn84Di&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.fqdn,params:'$fqdn',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.fqdn:(query:'$fqdn',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:gitaly,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:gitaly,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [📈 Kibana: Gitaly failed requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AW5F1OHTiGcMMNRn84Di&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.fqdn,params:'$fqdn',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.fqdn:(query:'$fqdn',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:gitaly,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:gitaly,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.grpc.code,negate:!t,params:OK,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.grpc.code:(query:OK,type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:exists,type:json.grpc.code,value:exists),query:(exists:(field:json.grpc.code)))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [📈 Kibana: Gitaly sum latency aggregated](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AW5F1OHTiGcMMNRn84Di&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.fqdn,params:'$fqdn',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.fqdn:(query:'$fqdn',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:gitaly,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:gitaly,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.grpc.time_ms),schema:metric,type:sum),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram),(enabled:!t,id:'3',params:(field:json.grpc.method.keyword,missingBucket:!f,missingBucketLabel:Missing,order:desc,orderBy:'1',otherBucket:!t,otherBucketLabel:Other,size:5),schema:group,type:terms)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'Sum+Request+Duration:+json.grpc.time_ms'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [📈 Kibana: Gitaly sum latency aggregated (split)](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AW5F1OHTiGcMMNRn84Di&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.fqdn,params:'$fqdn',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.fqdn:(query:'$fqdn',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:gitaly,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:gitaly,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.grpc.time_ms),schema:metric,type:sum),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram),(enabled:!t,id:'3',params:(field:json.grpc.method.keyword,missingBucket:!f,missingBucketLabel:Missing,order:desc,orderBy:'1',otherBucket:!t,otherBucketLabel:Other,size:5),schema:group,type:terms)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'Sum+Request+Duration:+json.grpc.time_ms'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [📈 Kibana: Gitaly percentile latency aggregated](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AW5F1OHTiGcMMNRn84Di&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.fqdn,params:'$fqdn',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.fqdn:(query:'$fqdn',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:gitaly,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:gitaly,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.grpc.time_ms,percents:!(95)),schema:metric,type:percentiles),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'p95+Request+Duration:+json.grpc.time_ms'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [📈 Kibana: Gitaly percentile latency aggregated (split)](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AW5F1OHTiGcMMNRn84Di&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.fqdn,params:'$fqdn',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.fqdn:(query:'$fqdn',type:phrase)))),(meta:(key:json.type,params:gitaly,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:gitaly,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.grpc.time_ms,percents:!(95)),schema:metric,type:percentiles),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram),(enabled:!t,id:'3',params:(field:json.grpc.method.keyword,missingBucket:!f,missingBucketLabel:Missing,order:desc,orderAgg:(enabled:!t,id:'3-orderAgg',params:(field:json.grpc.time_ms),schema:orderAgg,type:sum),orderBy:custom,otherBucket:!t,otherBucketLabel:Other,size:5),schema:group,type:terms)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'p95+Request+Duration:+json.grpc.time_ms'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
panels.title: Details

panels.description: The amount of non-idle time consumed by nodes for this service
panels.title: Node CPU

panels.description: The maximum utilization of a single core on each node. Lower is better
panels.title: Node Maximum Single Core Utilization

panels.description: Network utilization for nodes for this service
panels.title: Node Network Utilization

panels.description: Memory utilization. Lower is better.
panels.title: Memory Utilization

panels.description: Disk Read IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read IOPs

panels.description: Disk Write IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write IOPs

panels.description: Disk Read throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read Throughput

panels.description: Disk Write throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Throughput

panels.description: Total time spent in read operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read Total Time

panels.description: Total time spent in write operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Total Time

panels.description: CPU scheduling waiting on the run queue, as a percentage of time. Aggregated to worst CPU per node. Lower is better.
panels.title: CPU Scheduling Waiting

panels.description: Loadavg (1 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load1{env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"})

panels.title: loadavg1 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (5 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load5{env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"})

panels.title: loadavg5 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (15 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load15{env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"})

panels.title: loadavg15 per core

panels.description:
Cgroup memory utilization per node.

Some services, notably Gitaly, are configured to run within a cgroup with a memory limit lower than the
memory limit for the node. This ensures that a traffic spike to Gitaly does not affect other services on the node.

If this resource is becoming saturated, this may indicate traffic spikes to Gitaly, abuse or possibly resource leaks in
the application. Gitaly or other git processes may be killed by the OOM killer when this resource is saturated.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        container_memory_usage_bytes{id="/system.slice/gitlab-runsvdir.service", env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"} -
        container_memory_cache{id="/system.slice/gitlab-runsvdir.service", env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"} -
        container_memory_swap{id="/system.slice/gitlab-runsvdir.service", env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"}
      )
      /
      container_spec_memory_limit_bytes{id="/system.slice/gitlab-runsvdir.service", env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cgroup_memory component saturation: Cgroup Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a service fleet.
If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average Service CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Disk space utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        1 - node_filesystem_avail_bytes{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"} / node_filesystem_size_bytes{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Space Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Disk sustained read IOPS utilization per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      rate(node_disk_reads_completed_total{device!="sda", env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"}[20m])
      /
      node_disk_max_read_iops{device!="sda", env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_sustained_read_iops component saturation: Disk Sustained Read IOPS Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Disk sustained read throughput utilization per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      rate(node_disk_read_bytes_total{device!="sda", env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"}[20m])
      /
      node_disk_max_read_bytes_seconds{device!="sda", env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_sustained_read_throughput component saturation: Disk Sustained Read Throughput Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Gitaly runs on Google Cloud's Persistent Disk product. This has a published sustained
maximum write IOPS value. This value can be exceeded for brief periods.

If a single node is consistently reaching saturation, it may indicate a noisy-neighbour repository,
possible abuse or it may indicate that the node needs rebalancing.

More information can be found at
https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/disks/performance.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      rate(node_disk_writes_completed_total{device!="sda", env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"}[20m])
      /
      node_disk_max_write_iops{device!="sda", env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_sustained_write_iops component saturation: Disk Sustained Write IOPS Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Gitaly runs on Google Cloud's Persistent Disk product. This has a published sustained
maximum write throughput value. This value can be exceeded for brief periods.

If a single node is consistently reaching saturation, it may indicate a noisy-neighbour repository,
possible abuse or it may indicate that the node needs rebalancing.

More information can be found at
https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/disks/performance.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      rate(node_disk_written_bytes_total{device!="sda", env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"}[20m])
      /
      node_disk_max_write_bytes_seconds{device!="sda", env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_sustained_write_throughput component saturation: Disk Sustained Write Throughput Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      instance:node_memory_utilization:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"} or instance:node_memory_utilisation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance

panels.description:
Average CPU utilization per Node.

If average CPU is saturated, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without(cpu, mode) (1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"}[5m]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Go's memory allocation strategy can make it look like a Go process is saturating memory when measured using RSS, when in fact
the process is not at risk of memory saturation. For this reason, we measure Go processes using the `go_memstat_alloc_bytes`
metric instead of RSS.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(env, environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (env, environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn) (
        go_memstats_alloc_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"}
      )
      /
      sum by (env, environment, tier, type, stage, shard, fqdn) (
        node_memory_MemTotal_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",fqdn=~"$fqdn",type="gitaly"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: go_memory component saturation: Go Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description: Number of Git commands running concurrently per node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Inflight Git Commands on Node

panels.description: Number of OOM Kills per server.
panels.title: OOM Kills on Node

panels.description: Golang uses a global lock on process spawning. In order to control contention on this lock Gitaly uses a safety valve. If a request is unable to obtain the lock within a period, a timeout occurs. These timeouts are serious and should be addressed. Non-zero is bad.
panels.title: Gitaly Spawn Timeouts per Node

panels.description: Percentage of requests that acquire a Gitaly rate-limit lock within 1 minute, by host and method
panels.title: Request % acquiring rate-limit lock within 1m, by host + method

panels.description: Seconds of CPU time consumed by gitaly child processes, per second. These are accounted once the process exits, so the reporting may occur later than the resource consumption.
panels.title: CPU Time

panels.description: Context switches incurred by child processes, per second. These are accounted once the process exits, so the reporting may occur later than the resource consumption.
panels.title: Context switches

panels.description: Minor page faults incurred by child processes, per second. These are accounted once the process exits, so the reporting may occur later than the resource consumption. The number of page faults serviced without any I/O activity; here I/O activity is avoided by "reclaiming" a page frame from the list of pages awaiting reallocation.
panels.title: Minor page faults

panels.description: Major page faults incurred by child processes, per second. These are accounted once the process exits, so the reporting may occur later than the resource consumption. The number of page faults serviced that required I/O activity.
panels.title: Major page faults

panels.description: Seconds of CPU time consumed by gitaly child processes, per second. These are accounted once the process exits, so the reporting may occur later than the resource consumption.
panels.title: CPU Time

panels.description: Context switches incurred by child processes, per second. These are accounted once the process exits, so the reporting may occur later than the resource consumption.
panels.title: Context switches

panels.description: Minor page faults incurred by child processes, per second. These are accounted once the process exits, so the reporting may occur later than the resource consumption. The number of page faults serviced without any I/O activity; here I/O activity is avoided by "reclaiming" a page frame from the list of pages awaiting reallocation.
panels.title: Minor page faults

panels.description: Major page faults incurred by child processes, per second. These are accounted once the process exits, so the reporting may occur later than the resource consumption. The number of page faults serviced that required I/O activity.
panels.title: Major page faults

panels.description: Seconds of CPU time consumed by gitaly child processes, per second. These are accounted once the process exits, so the reporting may occur later than the resource consumption.
panels.title: CPU Time

panels.description: Context switches incurred by child processes, per second. These are accounted once the process exits, so the reporting may occur later than the resource consumption.
panels.title: Context switches

panels.description: Minor page faults incurred by child processes, per second. These are accounted once the process exits, so the reporting may occur later than the resource consumption. The number of page faults serviced without any I/O activity; here I/O activity is avoided by "reclaiming" a page frame from the list of pages awaiting reallocation.
panels.title: Minor page faults

panels.description: Major page faults incurred by child processes, per second. These are accounted once the process exits, so the reporting may occur later than the resource consumption. The number of page faults serviced that required I/O activity.
panels.title: Major page faults

panels.content:
These metrics are collected whenever a process that was spawned by gitaly exits.

**Contrast to process metrics:**

These metrics are more complete than the sampled process exporter metrics, in particular
we account for all of the resources spent by short-lived processes -- which process sampling
is prone to miss.

**Pitfalls:**

Because we only report on exit, long-running processes will only be shown here once they finish.
Once they do, all of their spent resources will be accounted for in one go, which may look like
a burst of activity.
panels.title: Details
gitaly command stats by commands per RPC

panels.description: Request rate for the Gitaly server
panels.title: Request rate by grpc_method

panels.description: Response rate for the Gitaly server
panels.title: Response rate by grpc_code

panels.description: Rate of CPU usage on every cgroup available on the Gitaly node.
panels.title: cgroup: CPU per cgroup

panels.description: P99/PX CPU usage of all cgroups available on the Gitaly node.
panels.title: cgroup: CPU

panels.description: RSS usage on every cgroup available on the Gitaly node.
panels.title: cgroup: Memory per cgroup

panels.description: P99/PX RRS usage of all cgroups available on the Gitaly node.
panels.title: cgroup: Memory

panels.description: Number of OOM Kills per server.
panels.title: OOM Kills on Node

panels.description: Cgroups that are getting CPU throttled. If the cgroup is not visable it is not getting throttled.
panels.title: cgroup: CPU Throttling

panels.content:
Gitaly spawns git processes into cgroups to limit their cpu and memory
usage. This is to cap the maximum amount of cpu/memory used by a single
git process and hence affecting other processes on the same host.
This helps in fair usage of system resources among all
the repositories hosted by a single Gitaly storage server.

Here is the runbook to debug issues related to Gitaly cgroups:
https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/blob/master/docs/gitaly/gitaly-repos-cgroup.md
panels.title: cgroup runbook

panels.content: Made with ❤️ and [Grafonnet](https://github.com/grafana/grafonnet-lib). [Contribute to this dashboard on GitLab.com](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/blob/master/dashboards)
